result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for Stay of Entry of Judgment and Order for Dismissal
Order for Stay of Entry of Judgment & Order for Dismissal
Motion for Stay of Entry of Judgment & Stipulated Conditions for Dismissal.

9:33 AM Defendant Jerry Vaughan Coplien in court.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Jerry Vaughan Coplien.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. The defendant enters a plea of no contest to all three counts. The Court finds the defendant guilty on all counts. The Court orders a Deferred Prosecution Agreement to be placed on count 1 for a period of . The Court directs a JOC be entered on counts 2 and 3. The Court orders a DPA for a period of 18 months be entered on count 1. The court orders counts 2 and 3 be an 18 month sentence to probation with the conditions being, paying all costs of this action, to remain clean and sober, to continue his AODA treatments, counseling and assessments, May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant. Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent. Defendant advised of post conviction relief. Defendant advised of firearm restriction. Defendant advised of U.S. non-citizen collateral consequences resulting in deportation, the exclusion of admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law. Defendant advised of voting rights.

9:12 AM Defendant Jerry Vaughan Coplien in court.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Jerry Vaughan Coplien.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set over.

Waiver of preliminary hearing filed with the court. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. The Court accepts the waiver. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Bond continues. Matter set over.
